properties.areaDesc: Mountains Of San Benito County And Interior Monterey County Including Pinnacles National Park; Southern Salinas Valley/Arroyo Seco and Lake San Antonio
properties.headline: Freeze Watch issued February 2 at 9:53PM PST until February 4 at 9:00AM PST by NWS San Francisco CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures likely, with overnight low
temperatures of 25-30 degrees forecast.

* WHERE...Southern Salinas Valley, Arroyo Seco, Lake San Antonio,
and Mountains Of San Benito County and Interior Monterey County,
Including Pinnacles National Park.

* WHEN...From late Monday evening through Tuesday morning.

* IMPACTS...Freeze conditions could kill crops and other sensitive
vegetation, and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
properties.instruction:
Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent
freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes, they
should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that
have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover
above-ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

NWSheadline: FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING
